meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dingy.
meanings.sent1: The old house showed signs of dinginesses in its dark corners.
meanings.sent2: The dinginesses of the room were evident from the lack of light and cleanliness.
meanings.sent3: Despite their best efforts, the cleaning crew couldn't rid the haunted house of its dinginesses.
meanings.sent4: The dinginesses of the city streets mirrored the gloom in his heart.
meanings.sent5: The dinginesses of the abandoned factory left a lasting impression on the visitors.

meanings.sent1: She noticed various dinginesses in the neglected room.
meanings.sent2: The dinginesses of the curtains and walls made the room feel unwelcoming.
meanings.sent3: The collection of different dinginesses in the attic was oddly fascinating.
meanings.sent4: The dinginesses of the alleyways seemed to blend into one dreary scene.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the different dinginesses of the city in his paintings.
